new_messages.content: Please analyze and update today's (2025-10-20 15:00:00) positions.

Step 1 ‚Äî Read positions and today‚Äôs prices
- Positions (shares): NVDA 13, AVGO 3, MU 9, Cash $30.77
- Today‚Äôs reference prices used (from provided ‚Äúcurrent value represented by the stocks you hold‚Äù):
  - NVDA $183.45
  - AVGO $349.33
  - MU $206.12

Step 2 ‚Äî Update valuation
- NVDA: 13 √ó 183.45 = $2,384.85
- AVGO: 3 √ó 349.33 = $1,047.99
- MU: 9 √ó 206.12 = $1,855.08
- Invested total (stocks): $5,287.92
- Cash: $30.77
- Portfolio total value: $5,287.92 + $30.77 = $5,318.69

Step 3 ‚Äî Current weights
- Including cash (approx):
  - NVDA: ~44.8%
  - AVGO: ~19.7%
  - MU: ~34.9%
  - Cash: ~0.6%
- Excluding cash (invested-only weights, approx):
  - NVDA: ~45.1%
  - AVGO: ~19.8%
  - MU: ~35.1%

Step 4 ‚Äî Market/news and sentiment checks (X/Reddit/web)
- NVIDIA (NVDA)
  - Web: Company indicated strong demand for Blackwell AI systems and continued scale-up of production in recent updates, citing ongoing AI inference/training demand (NVIDIA press/IR).
  - Potential macro headwind: Ongoing China export controls headlines persist, but U.S. hyperscale and enterprise demand remains the major driver.
  - Earnings timing: Broadly expected mid-November 2025 (various calendars; exact date to be confirmed via IR).
- Micron (MU)
  - Web: UBS (Oct 8) raised MU target to $225 on stronger HBM demand outlook; broader HBM market growth expectations remain robust into 2026 based on recent industry reports.
  - Catalysts: HBM3E ramp and expanding HBM capacity; next earnings typically in December for fiscal Q1.
- Broadcom (AVGO)
  - Web: AVGO highlighting end-to-end AI networking (Tomahawk 6, Jericho4, CPO) at OCP 2025; positive for data center networking leadership.
  - Next earnings: Market calendars indicate mid-December 2025.

Note: X/Reddit scraping required login for many posts; however, broader web sources confirm continued AI infrastructure momentum (NVDA demand, HBM strength for MU, and AVGO networking advances).

Step 5 ‚Äî Decision and any trades
- Liquidity: Cash balance ~$30.77 is insufficient to purchase additional shares of current holdings.
- Rebalancing: Current allocation is a concentrated AI-semi basket (NVDA, MU, AVGO). Given:
  - Constructive near-term catalysts (NVDA earnings likely in ~4 weeks; MU HBM tailwinds; AVGO AI networking momentum),
  - No negative, stock-specific developments found today that warrant de-risking,
  - Insufficient cash to build diversification without selling,
I am maintaining current positions without change today.

No trades executed.

Monitoring/next steps
- Confirm NVDA‚Äôs exact earnings date via IR and reassess positioning 1‚Äì2 weeks before report.
- Track HBM pricing/lead-time updates (Samsung/SK Hynix/Micron), and any MU capacity guidance changes.
- Watch AVGO‚Äôs customer ASIC pipeline updates and AI networking demand indicators.

Summary
- Portfolio value: $5,318.69
- Positions unchanged: NVDA 13, AVGO 3, MU 9, Cash $30.77
- Rationale: Positive AI infrastructure momentum; near-term catalysts; no compelling reason to rebalance today given tiny cash and favorable setup.

<FINISH_SIGNAL>

URL: http://nvidianews.nvidia.com/news/nvidia-announces-financial-results-for-fourth-quarter-and-fiscal-2025
Title: NVIDIA Announces Financial Results for Fourth Quarter and Fiscal 2025
Description: NVIDIA (NASDAQ: NVDA) today reported revenue for the fourth quarter ended January 26, 2025, of $39.3 billion, up 12% from the previous quarter and up 78% from a year ago.
Publish Time: unknown
Content: NVIDIA (NASDAQ: NVDA) today reported revenue for the fourth quarter ended January 26, 2025, of $39.3 billion, up 12% from the previous quarter and up 78% from a year ago.

For the quarter, GAAP earnings per diluted share was $0.89, up 14% from the previous quarter and up 82% from a year ago. Non-GAAP earnings per diluted share was $0.89, up 10% from the previous quarter and up 71% from a year ago.

For fiscal 2025, revenue was $130.5 billion, up 114% from a year ago. GAAP earnings per diluted share was $2.94, up 147% from a year ago. Non-GAAP earnings per diluted share was $2.99, up 130% from a year ago.

‚ÄúDemand for Blackwell is amazing as reasoning AI adds another scaling law ‚Äî increasing compute for training makes models smarter and increasing compute for long thinking makes the answer smarter,‚Äù said Jensen Huang, founder and CEO of NVIDIA.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve successfully ramped up the massive-scale production of Blackwell AI supercomputers, achieving billions of dollars in sales in its first ...
